intro: Onychium siliculosum var. chrysocarpum, commonly known as the golden-fruited onychium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruiting bodies are unique, developing into elongated, yellowish structures that give the species its common name. This variant is notable for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
